SummaryFileEditor Object¶

Summary¶

A class that handles 'get'-ing and 'write'-ing of summary files. It is built on top of the SummaryFile() class.

Current Status¶

The SummaryFileEditor object is fully operational.

Future Work¶

There is no future work planned at this moment.

Known Bugs¶

There are no known bugs.

Source Code¶

class PyStrahl.core.editor.SummaryFileEditor(sum_fn, verbosity=False)[source]¶

Summary: A class that handles 'get'-ing and 'write'-ing of summary files. It is built on top of the SummaryFile() class.

To Do:
Add HDF5
__init__(sum_fn, verbosity=False)[source]¶

Initializes a summary file editor object.

Parameters:
  • sum_fn [str] (*) -- The summary files name
  • verbosity [bool|False] (*) -- turns on and off verbose ouput
* **loadable** [bool|False]

determines if something has been written to this summary file.

* **verbose** [bool|False]

determines if verbose execution is used.

get()[source]¶

Gets the summary file using the serialization on the file extension.

Returns:The Python converted JSON dictionary that was read in from the summary file. If the object cannot be converted then None is returned.
write(dic)[source]¶

Writes the input file into a summary file using the serialization on the file extension.

Parameters:dic [dic] (*) -- A dictionary summary of the object which is created using custom method for the file and parameter objects.
